sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Ana Lázaro, Euronews, Pechino. Protesters are once again taking to the streets across France this Thursday against an unpopular reform of the pension system pushed through by Emmanuel Macron's administration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And while this may seem like déjà vu, what people here say we're witnessing is a turning point in this movement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This is the first national day of strike since the very first meeting held between union leaders and the French government. A meeting unions have described as useless and the French government said was an important step. All sides in this standoff are expecting a verdict on the part of France's constitutional council that has the power to strike out parts or the entire legislation next week. Until then unions che ha il potere di sbattere parti o l'intera legislazione la settimana prossima.
